greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of Product_{i>=1} (1+x^(4*i-1)).
comment: Number of partitions into distinct parts 4*k+3.
Convolution of A147599 and A169975 is A000700. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 18 2017
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: G.f. sum(n>=0, x^(2*n^2+n) / prod(k=1,n, 1-x^(4*k))) - _Joerg Arndt_, Mar 10 2011.
mathematica: nmax = 200; CoefficientList[Series[Product[(1 + x^(4*k - 1)), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 18 2017 *)

nmax = 200; poly = ConstantArray[0, nmax + 1]; poly[[1]] = 1; poly[[2]] = 0; Do[If[Mod[k, 4] == 3, Do[poly[[j + 1]] += poly[[j - k + 1]], {j, nmax, k, -1}]; ], {k, 2, nmax}]; poly (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 18 2017 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 29 2010
